title: --crypt-directory-name-encryption not parsed / breaks rclone
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Using `--crypt-directory-name-encryption` breaks rclone. If I remove that single argument from my command below, it works correctly.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.45
- os/arch: darwin/amd64
- go version: go1.11.2
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
macOS 10.13.6


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Backblaze B2


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
I'm trying to run crypted sync, without using config file.

```
password=`rclone obscure x`

rclone sync \
    --b2-account a \
    --b2-key b \
    --crypt-remote :b2:c \
    --crypt-filename-encryption off \
    --crypt-directory-name-encryption false \
    --crypt-password "$password" \
    -vv \
    . :crypt:
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
2018/12/23 01:54:33 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "--b2-account" "a" "--b2-key" "b" "--crypt-remote" ":b2:c" "--crypt-filename-encryption" "off" "--crypt-directory-name-encryption" "false" "--crypt-password" "LpijcJx8ESN58IspI8vCri8" "-vv" "." ":crypt:"]
Usage:
  rclone sync source:path dest:path [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help   help for sync

Use "rclone [command] --help" for more information about a command.
Use "rclone help flags" for to see the global flags.
Use "rclone help backends" for a list of supported services.
Command sync needs 2 arguments maximum
```
